com.deprez

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.deprez.Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object

    The main class of the project. Accesses and writes the database. Manages the user interface.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    William Deprez
    See Also:
    User, Community, App, Store, UserAppReview, UserAppReviews, Database

      Manages the elements of the MMJFrame.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Community community
      The list of users.
      private Driver.CommunityJFrame communityJFrame
      The member declaration of the inner CommunityJFrame class.
      private java.lang.String currentUser
      The current User object declared within the LoginJFrame class.
      private Database database
      The Database instance.
      (package private) static java.util.logging.Logger LOGGER
      The static logger for the package.
      private Driver.LoginJFrame loginJFrame
      The member declaration of the inner LoginJFrame class.
      private Driver.MMJFrame mmJFrame
      The member declaration of the inner MMJFrame class.
      private Store store
      The list of apps.
      private Driver.StoreJFrame storeJFrame
      The member declaration of the inner StoreJFrame class.
      private UserAppReviews userAppReviews
      The Many-to-Many relationship pair of userId and appIds
      This helps manage the Users, Apps, and the Review score and detail associated with those pairs.
      For example: userId = 1 adds app with appId = 5 to their account In order to manage this pair of identifiers without the UserAppReview list, It would be necessary to add the appId or userId to each App object and User object.

      • userAppReviews

        private UserAppReviews userAppReviews
        The Many-to-Many relationship pair of userId and appIds
        This helps manage the Users, Apps, and the Review score and detail associated with those pairs.
        For example: userId = 1 adds app with appId = 5 to their account In order to manage this pair of identifiers without the UserAppReview list, It would be necessary to add the appId or userId to each App object and User object. Obviously this would become incredibly inefficient, especially when attempting to remove either of those objects from Store or Community
        See Also:
        Database, App, User, UserAppReview, Store, Community, UserAppReviews
